BTW, one of my sync client is behind firewall, it can only accept connections _passively_ and output response. I've tried lots sync tools, syncthing is the only one that making it out. How do u accomplish this?

If you have two devices, A and B, it doesn't matter whether A can establish a connection to B, or B can establish a connection to A: both devices will use any connection. Therefore if A is entirely passive, but B can receive connections, A will managed to connect to B and both will use that connection.

Hi, 

I am also using syncthing-inotify and is does a great job. But I can confirm the behavior regarding the sub parameter as mentioned above: Triggering the ".stfolder" file in the root of a Folder (as periodically done by syncthing-inotify) causes a complete scan of the Folder. In case of a large Picture Library and a lot of xml/sqlite files (e.g., iPhoto-Library) this can take a long time and creates a lot of IO.

In syncthing/lib/model/model.go "func (m *Model) internalScanFolderSubs(folder string, subs []string)" 
only the parent of sub is taken into account. Hence, triggering ".stfolder" as sub causes a complete scan of the folder. Is that the desired behavior?

As workaround I created a ".stfolderInotify" folder in each of my syncthing Folders and patched syncthing-inotify 
-                               callback(folder, []string{".stfolder"})
-                               callback(folder, []string{".stfolderInotify/."})
  to trigger  ".stfolderInotify/." periodically.

Kind regards

`.stfolder` is magic as it's ignored. This means it does not exist, and we fall back to scan the parent, i.e. the whole folder. We should either handle scan requests for that (i.e. just forget about all requests to scan ignored stuff), or syncthing-inotify should not  be sending them. I'm not sure what's cleanest.

rename.to: Requesting scan of ignored file scans parent

body:
Why do we even get scan requests for .stfolder? It should never change so no need to ask for a scan of it?

/cc @Zillode
FWIW, SyncTrayzor takes the approach of not informing Syncthing about changes to ignored stuff.

> Why do we even get scan requests for .stfolder? It should never change so no need to ask for a scan of it?

To delay the scan interval timeout
Aha. Unfortunate choice, but that makes sense then. We should fix this.

For `syncthing-inotify` would it make sense to have a new `/rest/db/reset-scan-delay` API call which would take a folder as an argument and simply reset the scan delay without doing any scanning? I could give this a try.
